title: Maserati MC12
summary: The Maserati MC12 (Tipo M144S) is a limited production two-seater sports car produced by Italian car maker Maserati to allow a racing variant to compete in the FIA GT Championship. The car entered production in 2004, with 25 cars produced. A further 25 were produced in 2005 after the FIA changed the rules and reduced the Maximum length allowed. The second batch of 25 are 150mm shorter than the originals, making a total of 50 cars available for customers.[6][9] With the addition of 12 cars produced for racing, only a total of 62 of these cars were ever produced.[10]
